page.title: 11Early Christianity
page.content: To a lot of people, Glastonbury is the birth-place of Christianity in Great Britain. There is a legend that Jesus came to Britain as a child. But much more frequently told is the story of Joseph of Arimathea. According to the Gospels, Joseph is the man in whose garden Christ was buried. After the Resurrection of Christ, Joseph set out to spread the Christian word. Arriving in Glastonbury with other followers of Christ, he spent the night on a hill south of the town. It is now aptly called Wearyall Hill. Joseph is said to have placed his staff into the ground from which spot grew a{hawthorn tree.} Joseph is also connected with legends concerning the{Chalice Well}one that the Holy Grail is hidden in the depths of the Well,and another that the blood and sweat of Jesus was in the Chalice.
